text: Circumstances do not make the man; they reveal him to himself.
author: James Allen

text: Step by honest step, the miles surrender.
author: Anonymous

text: One more try is often the difference between almost and done.
author: Anonymous

text: Dripping water hollows the stone, not by force but by falling often.
author: Ovid

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules.
author: Anthony Trollope

text: Finish the next inch; the road will meet you.
author: Anonymous

text: Consistency is a quiet superpower.
author: Anonymous

text: You are closer than your doubt suggests.
author: Anonymous

text: The anvil outlasts the hammer.
author: Spanish Proverb

text: Patience and time do more than strength or passion.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: When you cannot run, walk; when you cannot walk, crawl; just do not stop.
author: Anonymous

text: Tiny hinges swing big doors.
author: Anonymous

text: Today’s ‘good enough’ repeated beats ‘perfect’ once.
author: Anonymous

text: Slow is still forward.
author: Anonymous

text: The routine is the result.
author: Anonymous

text: Be stubborn about the goal and flexible with the path.
author: Anonymous

text: Keep promises to your future self.
author: Anonymous

text: Stack small wins until they look like a miracle.
author: Anonymous

text: When it feels slow, it’s working.
author: Anonymous
